channel.title: Applet using setSize
channel.description: Hello guys, I want to make an math equation shower.. and I thought about doing it in Java using an applet on my website.. Is it possible to resize the applet by any chance? Yakman told me it wasn't possible, but I have seen some setSize functions under Applet, but I haven't seemed to get it working.. Any info is warmly welcome, thanks in advance..

item.title: Applet using setSize
item.dc:creator: @Lorax Lorax
item.description:
@Lorax wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:6, topic:65478”]try using php to generate the applet size dynamicly…

it can be done[/quote]
I thought of using Javascript and generate the applet using that, because in the Javascript I could “easily” make a function that would determine what would be the required length and width…

But in the mean time, I found that Wikipedia uses something called LaTeX, and I would rather use this than making my own because it seems to be a rather large project…

I haven’t yet been able to actually figure out how to include LaTeX, but I hope that I will figure it out eventually…

Read full topic

item.title: Applet using setSize
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:2, topic:65478”]An applet is embedded into a webpage, and once it’s loaded, the JVM, not the browser takes care of it, so that rules JavaScript out.

Nope, I’m out of ideas.[/quote]

Tbh, the applet is inside an invisible frame which is inside another invisible frame, and that frame is inside the browser.

[quote=“io9, post:2, topic:65478”]An applet is embedded into a webpage, and once it’s loaded, the JVM, not the browser takes care of it, so that rules JavaScript out.

Nope, I’m out of ideas.[/quote]

var a = document.getElementByID("whatever");
a.height = y;
a.width = x;

showDocument ftw

Read full topic
